amendatorysection.chaptername: Cities And Villages; Laws Applicable To All
amendatorysection.catchline: Street; common boundary with county or other municipality; concurrent and joint jurisdiction; limitation.
amendatorysection.para: The governing body of any city shall have concurrent and joint jurisdiction with the county board of any county and the governing body of any municipality over any street which is contiguous to and forms a common boundary between such city and any county or municipality. The governing body of any city shall have the right and authority to exercise all powers over such street as it may over streets within its corporate limits with the cooperation and concurrence of the county board or the governing body of any other municipality. Nothing herein shall be construed as granting any power of annexation which is not otherwise granted.
